comments.body:
As noted: Unfortunately, then didn't add a `make install` command. I expect this is partially because they don't run configure so they don't determine what prefix to install to. Fortunately, it isn't too bad to copy things over.

I manually inspected what got built by forcing a failure at the end of the `make check` step and this is what I found to be useful. The rest is `*.o` files, `*.cc` files, and `*.h` files (that appeared useful for the build only not as external API).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@

### Install manually ( no make install :) )

# Ensure there is somewhere to put this stuff

comments.body: The useful API was all nicely placed in this `include/leveldb` directory. So, it was simple to transfer this over.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +19,23 @@
# Move over the includes
mv include/leveldb $PREFIX/include/

comments.body: Shouldn't be a problem, but figured I would make sure these directories are created if not already there.
`snappy` might create some of them, but I figured just to be safe, right?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@# Ensure there is somewhere to put this stuff
mkdir -p $PREFIX/include
mkdir -p $PREFIX/lib

# Move over the libs
